turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello, hi, how you doing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Hi</UNSURE>. Good, thank you. How are you?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fine thanks, yeah. I'm Joe, I'm one of the doctors at Babylon. Can i just confirm your name please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> you. Um, my name's Lizzy Irvine. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Twenty third of July, nineteen ninety five.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Great</UNSURE>, thank you, Lizzy. Um, and are you, in a, confidential and comfortable space to talk?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah. <UNSURE>Especially</UNSURE> on a Friday. Comfortable.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Great</UNSURE>. Um, how can I help?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, just for the last couple of days, um, I've been, feeling, um, really sick in my, lower tummy.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and I've had a bit of a temperature, so feeling quite like hot and sweaty. And it's yeah, getting really uncomfortable.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, so you've been feeling, uh nauseous. Um, and you've had some, pain in your lower tummy? Or you say you've been feeling sick in your lower tummy?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it's more of an ache. So, like an ache in my lower tummy. And then I, I think <UNIN/> feeling hot and sweaty. So <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> think it's sickness, but, yeah, bit of an ache.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNSURE>So a bit um</UNSURE>. Feeling, hot, sweaty, unwell, for three days. Uh, feeling sick, nausea, um, with an ache in your lower tummy. Any actual vomiting?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so yeah, no just nauseous, no vomiting yet, luckily. And it's only been for a couple of days, but yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Two days yeah. OK. Um, and uh, any problems with your waterworks or diarrhoea?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, so I'm, I'm going <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, I'm going to the loo a little bit more often than usual. Um, <UNIN/>, I drink lots of water, but it does feel like more often.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> <UNSURE>about</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, like nothing, nothing too out of the ordinary. Um, and I was, I was a little bit like um, uh, I don't know constipated I guess, <UNSURE>uh</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: About a week ago, but I'm OK now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So <UNSURE>you've</UNSURE>, bit constipated a week ago. Uh <UNIN/>, things uh.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You're having regular bowel motions now. You said you had a, bit of, diarrhoea, <UNSURE>or</UNSURE> a bit of watery, did you say?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, it was more like I was just, a little bit bunged up, and then, about a week ago that kinda cleared, and I'm <UNSURE>a</UNSURE>, normal now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, you say you're going, you're drinking lots of water. You're going to the toilet more frequently, for a wee, is that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yeah I'd say so. I, I tend to drink a lot of water anyway but, I feel like I'm going to the toilet, more.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hmm. Any pain when you pass urine?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, no pain.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No stinging?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. Just <UNIN/>, it seems, normal yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and um, and sort of no foul smelling urine, or anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, nothing, nothing I can think of, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>You</UNSURE> having, <UNSURE>you're</UNSURE> saying you, you're going a bit more frequently. <UNSURE>And</UNSURE> <UNIN/> are you having to go with urgency, to the toilet, for a wee?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, there's no urgency. Um, yeah, no pain or urgency.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Just, yeah, peeing quite frequently, but it's all seeming normal. Yeah, I probably wouldn't have, thought of, it being, linked but, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right so you're. Um, so the main symptom is feeling sick, uh with this. Uh, and you've been feeling bunged up, and this <UNIN/> <UNSURE>this</UNSURE> sort of, pain in your tummy.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Just to ask a few more question about the pain in your tummy. Is it, how would you describe the pain?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it's like below my belly button. Um, it's, it's aching. Um, it does make me feel nauseous. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so it's kinda more like a, I guess like an, an, a, a dull ache. Um, just below the belly button, kind of, yeah, here.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and it's, it, is it constant? Or is it coming and going?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's, yeah it's, feeling pretty constant, over the last couple of day.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>It</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and just need to ask a few questions about, uh, your periods and stuff. Uh, any chance you could be pregnant at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ooh, I don't know.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, probably not, I don't think so. I'm very <UNSURE>careful</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> sexually active at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, um, <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: You mentioned about periods. I did notice a bit of, um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I don't know it's like <UNIN/>, not necessarily like spotting, but in like, in my, my pee is like a little, I suppose. I think I thought it was my period, it's like a little bit, pink.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: In your pee, did you say? Your, so your pee is slightly red? Or slightly pink?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But I am kind of like due, <UNIN/> on my, didn't know if that was like, yeah, a part of it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, when was your last menstrual period?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, around a month ago, yeah, three and a, three and a bit weeks ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Ah, OK. Um, so it's three <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, uh, did you say? So you're sexually active, you're using contraception? <UNSURE>And what</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mm-hmm, yeah. I've got the arm, the implants.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, <UNIN/>, one sexual partner? Um, a regular, regular boyfriend or?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yep</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> , to go back to your symptom of, uh, constipation. Can I just clarify, when was the last time you had a bowel motion?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yesterday.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and, uh, do you feel like, you, are still quite bunged up at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no it seems to have cleared up. So I was, about a week ago, but I'm OK, OK now, the last few days.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> K.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. So you, just to sort of confirm your symptoms. Um, you're feeling sort of sick, nauseous, with tummy pain, which is fairly constant.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, how, <UNIN/>, did the tummy pain come on suddenly or gradually?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's only been for the last two days. Um, so I guess yeah, quite recently.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So it's, it's come on gradually, has it?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Not a sudden onset?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and uh, your last menstrual period was just three and a bit weeks ago. Um, <UNIN/>and you, but you say you've had some <UNIN/>. A little bit of spotting, possibly before um, in-between periods, or recently.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, <UNSURE>and</UNSURE> the last kind of week or so, yeah, the last couple of days really.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But, because I was due on.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I, I think. Yeah, just the last couple of days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, <UNSURE>and</UNSURE>, but you're expecting your period soon?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. Um. OK, and just to <UNIN/> ask a few <UNSURE>questions</UNSURE>. Are you, uh, do you have any other medical, uh, problems? Um, <UNSURE>that</UNSURE> I need to be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Uh</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Don't <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm um, allergic <UNSURE>to Amoxicillin</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Allergic to Amoxicillin. Um, but no other medical problems, <UNSURE>that you</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, not that I'm aware of.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Any drug allergies? <UNSURE>Ohh</UNSURE>, you mentioned Amoxicillin, but anything else?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, that's it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and, do you take any medications at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, no medications, but I'm on the implants. I think it's called um, Implanon.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Implanon</UNSURE>, yeah sure. OK. Uh, do you smoke?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Or something.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, and uh, do you live with, uh, alone? With your partner?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: With my boyfriend.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: With your boyfriend. And, um, any other medical, uh sorry, any, uh, <UNSURE>diseases</UNSURE> run in your, run in your family?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not any <UNSURE>that</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Spring to mind in my immediate family. Um, my brother is a type one diabetic.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> great so, um, is there anything that you're particularly concerned about with, um, this <UNIN/> nausea, and uh, the constipation?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I don't know it just a really, like <UNIN/> really horrible ache. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I'm nauseous, hot, sweaty, feeling, I'm not really sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Mmm</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I, yeah, why it's happening, um. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> the last couple of days, that's probably all that's.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Any</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it's getting <UNSURE>uncomfortable</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. Anything that you'd hoped, particularly, to get out of having this consultation?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Anything <UNIN/>, sorry?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> was there anything that you'd hoped to, get out of having this specific consultation? Other than a diagnosis, and getting better, and, you know, being on the right track to, to, feeling better?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I know that's kind of, I just wanna, um, get back <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Get <UNIN/> to normal, yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> but a bit more <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, <UNSURE>sure</UNSURE>, sure. OK, um, so, and then finally. I, I didn't ask you, do you have any discharge, or anything like that, from down below?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, no, no discharge.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No discharge. OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. So, um, I <UNIN/>, I, I think, uh.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: This could be a few different things. It could just be simple constipation. Uh, you mentioned that you were bunged up, but you did go yesterday. So it's, um, and your, your bowel habits, that you've been going regularly.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, but you did mention that you were bunged up. Um, but there could be a few other things going on.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I would quite like to, uh, see you to do some further, to do an examination, and to do some, some tests as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, we need to definitely rule out pregnancy, with you. And possibly, um, do some other examinations or, or <UNIN/> further tests. So, would you be happy to actually see a GP face-to-face, um, soon?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Today, ideally.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure, I can make time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Are you, and you're feeling hot, hot and, sweaty. Have you been feeling, um, light-headed at all? Or like you're going to faint?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no, not like I'm gonna faint.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Right well, we're just sort of, <UNSURE>timing out</UNSURE>, running out of time a little bit. But, um, I'd really like to see you, uh, <UNIN/> for some more, uh, examination, investigations.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: If in the meantime <UNIN/> um, between now and, and me, sort or a GP seeing you, you feel worse in any way, you get light-headed.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, you, uh, uh you have, you develop any symptoms which are concerning to you. Um, then I think <UNSURE>you should</UNSURE> take them quite seriously, and, and see somebody more urgently if possible.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, OK. Is that, uh, <UNIN/>, was there anything else that you wanna talk about right now? I'm glad we got the ball rolling with this, and uh, we can <UNIN/>, um, sort of see you again, to take this a little bit further.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Mm-hmm</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, thank you, really appreciate that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. Thanks for your time.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> cheers, <UNSURE>bye</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Thanks, bye.
